item.description:
Taza Chocolate, a Somerville-based factory and shop, is known for its Mexican style, stone ground chocolate. For this reason, when Cinco de Mayo comes around, the local business will bring Mexican culture to Windsor Street by shutting it down and throwing a block party.

From 1-5 p.m. on May 5, the chocolate factory will host up to 500 people who can enjoy two taco trucks, free samples from Ole Mexican Grill, margaritas from El Buho Mezcal and Ripe Craft Bar Juice, and live music by DJ Riobamba. Sodas by Spindrift and beer from Brooklyn Brewery will also be available. The event is free and open to the public. All ages are welcome.

Links:
http://www.boston.com/yourtown/news/somerville/2013/04/taza_chocolate_to_hold_cinco_d.html

http://www.tazachocolate.com/Social/Cinco_de_Mayo_block_party
item.name: Cinco de Mayo Taza Chocolate Block Party!
